perturbation.original_text:
(A) Information Exchange. Within forty-five (45) days after the Effective Date, Seller shall provide (I) to the Purchaser, an updated list of all Patents (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule) owned by any Seller Party that (x) have an effective filing date or are based on an invention disclosure having a date of disclosure that is on or after January 9, 2007, and (y) that name as inventors, in Seller's reasonable, good-faith belief, one or more Business Employees and one or more Persons that are not Business Employees (the "Patent Review List"), and (II) to the Invention Disclosure Review Team, a list of invention disclosures (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule or Schedule 1.1(j)) owned by any Seller Party that name as contributors one or more Business Employees

28

and one or more Persons that are not Business Employees (which list shall include the contributors, the title thereof, and the "location code" therefor) (the "Invention Disclosure Review List"). The Patent Review List shall include the Patents set forth on Schedule 2.1(b)(iii)(A).
perturbation.changed_text:
(A) Information Exchange. Within five (5) days after the Effective Date, Seller shall provide (I) to the Purchaser, an updated list of all Patents (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule) owned by any Seller Party that (x) have an effective filing date or are based on an invention disclosure having a date of disclosure that is on or after January 9, 2007, and (y) that name as inventors, in Seller's reasonable, good-faith belief, one or more Business Employees and one or more Persons that are not Business Employees (the "Patent Review List"), and (II) to the Invention Disclosure Review Team, a list of invention disclosures (other than those set forth on Schedule 1.1(l) of the Seller IPA Disclosure Schedule or Schedule 1.1(j)) owned by any Seller Party that name as contributors one or more Business Employees

28

and one or more Persons that are not Business Employees (which list shall include the contributors, the title thereof, and the "location code" therefor) (the "Invention Disclosure Review List"). The Patent Review List shall include the Patents set forth on Schedule 2.1(b)(iii)(A).
perturbation.explanation: The original text provided 45 days for the seller to provide an updated list of patents to the purchaser after the effective date. I have modified the text to require the seller to provide the list within 5 days of the effective date. This could be seen as an unreasonable and impractical timeline, especially considering the complexity of patent portfolios and the potential need for a thorough review. Therefore it is an inconsistency as the action has been modified to create non-compliance with regulatory standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness of Terms

perturbation.original_text:
(C) Invention Disclosure Review and Ownership. During the Review Period, within seventy-five (75) days after the Effective Date (or, in the event of any repeat of the process set forth in this Section 2.1(b)(iii)(C) in accordance with Section 2.1(b)(iii)(D), promptly (and no later than seventy-five (75) days) thereafter), Seller shall cause (on and prior to the Initial Closing Date), or the parties shall each cause (following the Initial Closing Date), as applicable, their respective employees on the Invention Disclosure Review Team to: (I) promptly review the Invention Disclosure Review List; (II) in good-faith determine whether any of the invention disclosures (and inventions listed on the Invention Disclosure Review List (and inventions described therein))
15
perturbation.changed_text:
(C) Invention Disclosure Review and Ownership. During the Review Period, within fifteen (15) days after the Effective Date (or, in the event of any repeat of the process set forth in this Section 2.1(b)(iii)(C) in accordance with Section 2.1(b)(iii)(D), promptly (and no later than fifteen (15) days) thereafter), Seller shall cause (on and prior to the Initial Closing Date), or the parties shall each cause (following the Initial Closing Date), as applicable, their respective employees on the Invention Disclosure Review Team to: (I) promptly review the Invention Disclosure Review List; (II) in good-faith determine whether any of the invention disclosures (and inventions listed on the Invention Disclosure Review List (and inventions described therein))
15
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows 75 days for the Invention Disclosure Review Team to review and determine whether any of the invention disclosures should be assigned. The modification reduces this to 15 days. This timeframe may be too short, given the volume and complexity of invention disclosures, potentially creating an unreasonable burden and non-compliance as review of the invention disclosures may be incomplete.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness of Terms

perturbation.original_text: (F) Arbitration. Attached as Schedule 2.1(b)(iii)(F) is a schedule of additional Patents provided by Seller to Purchaser prior to the Effective Date for review with respect to ownership allocation between the parties pursuant to the general guidelines and principles set forth in Section 2.1(b)(iii)(B) (the "Additional Patents"). The parties shall promptly, in good- faith, discuss and negotiate whether any of the Additional Patents should be or should have been, as applicable, an Assigned Patent. If any of such Additional Patents are not reviewed, or the parties cannot agree on whether any Additional Patent should be or should have been, as applicable, an Assigned Patent, prior to the Initial Closing Date, then the parties shall escalate such dispute to successively more senior-levels of executives as set forth in Section 2.1(b)(iii)(B). If such senior-levels of executives cannot resolve the dispute with respect to any such Patents (the "Outstanding Patents") by the Initial Closing Date, then either party may, within thirty (30) days after the Initial Closing Date,
perturbation.changed_text: (F) Arbitration. Attached as Schedule 2.1(b)(iii)(F) is a schedule of additional Patents provided by Seller to Purchaser prior to the Effective Date for review with respect to ownership allocation between the parties pursuant to the general guidelines and principles set forth in Section 2.1(b)(iii)(B) (the "Additional Patents"). The parties shall promptly, in good- faith, discuss and negotiate whether any of the Additional Patents should be or should have been, as applicable, an Assigned Patent. If any of such Additional Patents are not reviewed, or the parties cannot agree on whether any Additional Patent should be or should have been, as applicable, an Assigned Patent, prior to the Initial Closing Date, then the parties shall escalate such dispute to successively more senior-levels of executives as set forth in Section 2.1(b)(iii)(B). If such senior-levels of executives cannot resolve the dispute with respect to any such Patents (the "Outstanding Patents") by the Initial Closing Date, then either party may, within ten (10) days after the Initial Closing Date,
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows 30 days after the Initial Closing Date for a party to submit unresolved patent disputes for arbitration. The modified text shortens this timeframe to 10 days. This could be seen as a contradiction of reasonableness as it would not be sufficient time, since there may be a need to consult with legal counsel, gather necessary documentation, and prepare the submission for arbitration, making it an unreasonable demand.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Reasonableness of Terms
